# eslint-plugin-unicorn open in new window open in new window

More than 100 powerful ESLint rules

You might want to check out XOopen in new window, which includes this plugin.

Propose or contribute a new rule â¡

# Install

npm install --save-dev eslint eslint-plugin-unicorn

# Usage (eslint.config.js)

Requires ESLint >=8.23.0.

Use a preset config or configure each rule in eslint.config.js.

If you don't use the preset, ensure you use the same languageOptions config as below.

# ES Module (Recommended)

import eslintPluginUnicorn from 'eslint-plugin-unicorn';
import * as eslintrc from '@eslint/eslintrc';

export default [
	{
		languageOptions: {
			globals: eslintrc.Legacy.environments.get('es2024'),
		},
		plugins: {
			unicorn: eslintPluginUnicorn,
		},
		rules: {
			'unicorn/better-regex': 'error',
			'unicorn/â€¦': 'error',
		},
	},
	// â€¦
];

# CommonJS

'use strict';
const eslintPluginUnicorn = require('eslint-plugin-unicorn');
const eslintrc = require('@eslint/eslintrc');

module.exports = [
	{
		languageOptions: {
			globals: eslintrc.Legacy.environments.get('es2024'),
		},
		plugins: {
			unicorn: eslintPluginUnicorn,
		},
		rules: {
			'unicorn/better-regex': 'error',
			'unicorn/â€¦': 'error',
		},
	},
	// â€¦
];

# Usage (legacy: .eslintrc.* or package.json)

Use a preset config or configure each rule in package.json.

If you don't use the preset, ensure you use the same env and parserOptions config as below.

{
	"name": "my-awesome-project",
	"eslintConfig": {
		"env": {
			"es2024": true
		},
		"parserOptions": {
			"ecmaVersion": "latest",
			"sourceType": "module"
		},
		"plugins": [
			"unicorn"
		],
		"rules": {
			"unicorn/better-regex": "error",
			"unicorn/â€¦": "error"
		}
	}
}

# Deprecated Rules

See docs/deprecated-rules.md

# Preset configs (eslint.config.js)

See the ESLint docsopen in new window for more information about extending config files.

Note: Preset configs will also enable the correct language optionsopen in new window.

# Recommended config

This plugin exports a recommended config that enforces good practices.

# ES Module (Recommended)

import eslintPluginUnicorn from 'eslint-plugin-unicorn';

export default [
		// â€¦
		eslintPluginUnicorn.configs['flat/recommended'],
		{
			rules: {
				'unicorn/better-regex': 'warn',
			},
		},
];

# CommonJS

'use strict';
const eslintPluginUnicorn = require('eslint-plugin-unicorn');

module.exports = [
		// â€¦
		eslintPluginUnicorn.configs['flat/recommended'],
		{
			rules: {
				'unicorn/better-regex': 'warn',
			},
		},
];

# All config

This plugin exports an all config that makes use of all rules (except for deprecated ones).

# ES Module (Recommended)

import eslintPluginUnicorn from 'eslint-plugin-unicorn';

export default [
		// â€¦
		eslintPluginUnicorn.configs['flat/all'],
		{
			rules: {
				'unicorn/better-regex': 'warn',
			},
		},
];

# CommonJS

'use strict';
const eslintPluginUnicorn = require('eslint-plugin-unicorn');

module.exports = [
		// â€¦
		eslintPluginUnicorn.configs['flat/all'],
		{
			rules: {
				'unicorn/better-regex': 'warn',
			},
		},
];

# Preset configs (.eslintrc.* or package.json)

See the ESLint docsopen in new window for more information about extending config files.

Note: Preset configs will also enable the correct parser optionsopen in new window and environmentopen in new window.

# Recommended config

This plugin exports a recommended config that enforces good practices.

{
	"name": "my-awesome-project",
	"eslintConfig": {
		"extends": "plugin:unicorn/recommended",
		"rules": {
			"unicorn/better-regex": "warn"
		}
	}
}

# All config

This plugin exports an all config that makes use of all rules (except for deprecated ones).

{
	"name": "my-awesome-project",
	"eslintConfig": {
		"extends": "plugin:unicorn/all"
	}
}
